required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Tibiofemoral Rotational Alignment After Mobile and Fixed Bearing Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Tibiofemoral Rotational Alignment After Mobile and Fixed Bearing Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The anatomic landmark for the anteroposterior (AP) axis of the proximal tibia and its variability was investigated in this study in order to determine whether a certain landmark could be employed as a reference axis for the proximal tibia after rotating platform mobile bearing (RP-MB) and fixed bearing (FB) total knee arthroplasties (TKAs).

detailed_description.textblock: Reference of tibial AP axis for implanting tibial component in total knee arthroplasty have not been concluded. This study can suggest appropriate method for alingning the tibial component to accurate tibial AP axis.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Tibial anteroposterior axis relative to femoral anteroposterior axis
primary_outcome.description: Tibial anteroposterior axis relative to femoral anteroposterior axis on Computed tomogram images

intervention.other_name: Sigma® RP-F Knee System, Depuy J&J, Warsaw, IN, USA
Nexgen® Legacy® Knee LPS-Flex, Zimmer, Warsaw, IN, USA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary osteoarthritis
Exclusion Criteria:
- infection
- inflammatory arthritis
- reoperation
- severe deformity
